title: Hecticity
body: It's been a hectic day here at work, but we get to leave an hour early to vote, so that's good news. I wish it were nicer outside so we could walk to the poll. That's all.
author: Dan

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I voted! My first time voting in a real-live election.

comments.author: Whittler
comments.body: Can one be hectified by hecticity?

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body:
I'm spending my evening with Dan Rather. One segment so far and he's been spot on. He described the difficulty in projecting the polls in states with early voting measures as akin to defusing a hydro-electro dam dynamo, or something like state. At the least, he said dynamo. This guy rules.

Rather/Conkrite in '08, no matter what the outcome tonight.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body: Get out your decoder rings: state = that.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Hecticity.  Very nice made up word.

comments.author: c
comments.body:
Huzzah! What you two are doing is wildly brave and inspiring and makes perfect sense. Jolly good show.

...please offer chocolate covered pretzels at your concession.

...please

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body: I voted. However, it didn't work the way I wanted it to. Only if I was a registered Ohio voter, than maybe it would have counted!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Nicole: congratulations!

Whittler: Yes, one can be.

Aaron: he told us to get off our duffs and go vote, if we hadn't already. Then he made a quip about a monkey and a can of shoe polish.

Oz: Thanks.

C: chocolate covered pretzels? I think we can handle that.

Einahpets: Your state is going to be in the eye of the storm for the next few weeks.
